tagged_story_for_tts:
Asphalt roads.<[silence]> Infrastructure backbone.<[silence]>
The word 'asphalt' derives from the Greek 'asphaltos'.<[silence]>
In 1870, the first modern asphalt road was laid in Newark, New Jersey.<[silence]>
Asphalt fabrication involves heating aggregates and bitumen to create a durable mixture.<[silence]>
Example: Interstate highways use asphalt for smoother, quieter rides.<[silence]>
Related subjects: civil engineering, road maintenance, urban planning.<[silence]>
clean_story: Asphalt roads. Infrastructure backbone. The word 'asphalt' derives from the Greek 'asphaltos'. In 1870, the first modern asphalt road was laid in Newark, New Jersey. Asphalt fabrication involves heating aggregates and bitumen to create a durable mixture. Example: Interstate highways use asphalt for smoother, quieter rides. Related subjects: civil engineering, road maintenance, urban planning.
